113.content:
In the midst of a old fashioned Japanese style dojo sat one boy. He looked no more than seventeen or eighteen with curly brown hair and eyes filled with discipline and sadness. He simply sat in the middle of the wooden floor with a sword spread on his lap. He eyed it with what appeared to be a mixture of hatred and nostalgia. This boy...was Suzaku Kururugi, and the blade....was what he had used to murder his father many years ago.

"It was this day..." Suzaku muttered sadly, this was the anniversary of the day his father died; and the time when Suzaku never felt more self loathing. Sure, Suzaku was a high ranking Japanese man, a historical figure even in the discrimatory Brittanian society. The Knight of Seven in Brittania's Knights of the Round, Knight to Euphiemia Li Brittania aka the "Blood Princess", pilot of the Lancelot, and greatest enemy of Zero. Even so, Suzaku's life was one filled with tragedy. The day he murdered his father. His lover and friend Euphie went down in history as the catalyst of a masscre, and perhaps most harmful of all...his best friend was Zero.

In his grief over Euphie Suzaku hunted down Lelouch who was Zero and captured him, giving him the title Knight of Seven. But even so...Suzaku has on multiple occasions shown remorse for such a deed. Lelouch cursed him with a command...to live...and against his will Suzaku had to obey. It was the power of Geass, the same power Lelouch used to become Zero...the same power he used to make Euphie cause a massacre. Suzaku cursed his fate, his cursed life, but because of Lelouch he couldn't end the misery.

Suzaku stopped dwelling on it all though and went to place the blade in a shrine to the side attributed to his father. He placed the blade before a picture of the stern faced man and rose to his feet. With a bow Suzaku turned and left. Right at the door, the Knight of Six, Anya, with her apathetic expression, was waiting.

"Suzaku...is everything okay?" She asked in what seemed to be concern but with Anya there was no tone or expression to make such seem the case.

Suzaku's eyes lit up with false happiness, "Of course Anya! What are you doing here?"

Anya boredly handed Suzaku what appeared to be a vial, "You're a horrible liar. And I came at the request of Earl Asplund to give you this."

"Lloyd?!" Suzaku asked in shock, ever since becoming a Knight he hadn't seen much of Lloyd. "What is this supposed to be for?"

Anya shrugged, " Earl Asplund just said it would improve your capabilities within Lancelot. He also mentioned a slight probability of side effects in a nonchalant tone."

"Heh...sounds like him...." Suzaku eyed the vial of liquid nervously, "I sure hope it doesn't turn me green or something."

Anya pulled a PDA from her pocket and clicked a button, "Saved, if you do turn green call me so I can record it as well..." With no farewell or anything Anya turned and left. Suzaku eyed the vial with disdain, half tempted to get rid of it but he gulped it all down as soon as possible. Almost immediately later Suzaku fell unconcious.

All that Suzaku remembered after that was getting up, Lloyd's little concoction had knocked him out. But soon after rising Suzaku gasped, for two reasons. One; Suzaku was completely naked. And Two; his clothes were right before him...about a thousand sizes too big. Somehow, Lloyd's drug had caused him to shrink!

"I am going to kill that man..." Was all he muttered before a guest came in....
113.title: Suzaku Shrinks

choices: I would love to assist you in your training!
I think it's best we try to find a solution as soon as possible.
Is it alright if I just....play with you a little first? This is just so amazing
1132.content:
Even miles away from the door Suzaku could clearly hear the booms of something massive approaching. Judging from the rhythm it was...a person...walking...no running towards....the training area Suzaku was in right now? He used his sense of hearing to clarify and he was correct; someone was coming. Suzaku's mind reeled at the possibilities of who it could be, a Knight of the Round...maybe a member of the royal family...possibly even a terrorist; none of these possibilities seemed particularly good. Suzaku got along with his fellow Knights but...they weren't the kind of people he would want to be around in his current state; Royalty was more or less the same way. A bunch of high level people used to being waded on hand and foot by servants, throwing a shrunken Suzaku into the mix was not a good idea, not at all. As for terrorists....well it kind of spoke for itself. Thankfully when the approaching person actually entered Suzaku was relieved to say the least. It wasn't a Knight, Royalty or a terrorist, it was Cecile Croomy!

She wore a regular army uniform as she entered, her eyes scanning the entire room for something; probably Suzaku. Her eyes quickly locked onto his clothing on the ground, and she ran to it. About a foot away from it Cecile stopped and knelt on her knee; eyes scanning furiously at the ground. "Am I too late?" Her worried voice boomed. The humongous blue eyes frantically moved about until they found their target; Suzaku waving his arms around for help. Suzaku's perspective on this was obviously quite different. When Cecile entered he was just...awestruck. She was always beautiful, Suzaku knew this but at the current size it had transcended beyond belief; the only woman who had done that for Suzaku himself was Euphie, and she was dead. Awe wasn't all he felt though, he was happy; Cecile was probably the most pure of heart person who could've found him and now that she was here he knew he had to get her attention. So hid did the only thing his size would've allowed to even remotely worked, he jumped around and screamed for the giantess' attention. When she came forward her army boots stopped just before him, and Suzaku was awestruck yet again by the mere size, he had to be smaller than one of the giantess' toes! If she just moved her foot a little bit...he would be a goner. Thankfully she found him in about a minute and death was no longer an issue.

Cecile spoke with a soft whisper, much better than the deafening boom of her regular voice. "Suzaku...is that you? Are you alright?"

In contrast to Cecile lowering her voice Suzaku had to raise his to the limits. "Yeah Miss Cecile! I took that drug Lloyd sent me and...this happened!"

Cecile bit her lip and gasped, "I was afraid of that. Lloyd...well he got a few items sent out at the same time. And...they got mixed up. You got a vial of experimental shrinking serum."

The malice arising from Suzaku was almost visible, "That man will die....."

Cecile nervously laughed, "I'm sure he deserves it but...you know him. Just leave it to me Suzaku. I'll make sure he learns his lesson later." The boy seemed to calm down, at least slightly. "Okay, but what about my situation? I can't exactly handle the Lancelot like this."

The giantess didn't look even slightly worried. "Me and Lloyd will fix you don't worry. If anything Lloyd won't let you get hurt."

"Yeah he doesn't wanna lose his guinea pig."

"I never said he had pure motives. " Cecile laughed.

Suzaku laughed a bit too, "So, is there a cure Miss Cecile?"

It was this question that made the giantess tense herself, a nervous bite of her lip brought fear and paranoia to Suzaku as well. Cecile didn't worry for nothing, she always had good reasons and if she appeared worried...it must've been bad. "Well....there might be. As I said it was an experimental serum that shrunk you. An antidote or a reversal process has yet to be created but if me and Lloyd put our minds to it we can find the cure!"

" IF there is one." The little Knight finished for her.

Cecile nodded, "Yes....but Suzaku I swear on my life that if this is irreversable Lloyd will pay...." The kind girl grew a scary expression, almost resembling a monster; but she looked at Suzaku again in her kind motherly face. "Sorry you saw that. I sometimes let my darker side come out when it comes to Lloyd." Suzaku was speechless in fear. Cecile nervously giggled, "Well worst case scenario I do like to play with dolls." Suzaku somehow found a way to be even silenter.

After a moment he could speak though, "So...um. Miss Cecile? What should we do now? I sort of wanted to finish my training before doing anything."

The giantess looked surprised, "Training? Even though you've shrunken?"

Suzaku shrugged, "Might as well. Nothing can be done now."

Cecile was silent for a moment, "Well Suzaku....
1132.title: Warning Too Late

11321.content:
“I’d love to help you with your training!” Cecile piped up with a warm smile, kneeling down so her face was closer to Suzaku.

“No that’s okay Miss Cecile. I’ll just-“ A twitch of the massive blue eyes before him made him stop. “I don’t want to be a bother or anything.”

The giantess gently shrugged, “I don’t mind. Since you’re this small I’m going to have to be around to keep an eye on you anyway. In a way, me helping you train will help keep me busy.”

Suzaku raised an eyebrow, “But what about helping Lloyd with finding a cure?”

“You’re the one who said you wanted to train first.” Cecile answered with a playful poke. Suzaku fell on his bottom causing a small chuckle from the giantess, “I guess I better be more careful.”

The shrunken man brushed himself off and stood back up. “I get the feeling I’m not going to talk you out of this. So I guess I’ll accept your offer Miss Cecile.”

“Please Suzaku, we’ve known each other for a long time now. Just call me Cecile.”

“Okay…Cecile.” Suzaku awkwardly let out her name with a smile. “What should we do first?”

The blue-haired woman’s eyes widened, “You mean you don’t know? Don’t you train every day?”

“Yeah, usually I’d be weight training right about now but finding weights would be kind of hard at the moment.”

The woman nodded, “And I know you; you’d find something next to impossible to lift and try so you can push yourself.” She paused to don a more stern expression, “But at this size I won’t allow that. You can’t do anything too dangerous when a single step could kill you.”

Suzaku scratched the back of his head, “Well I kind of need something dangerous to really train. It helps motivate me. And anything that isn’t heavy for weights won’t do any help either. It’s not like there’s something out there super heavy but soft as a pillow.”

Cecile tilted her head for a moment to think. “Actually…there might be.” She stood back up and walked towards the shrine Suzaku had of his father. Briefly Cecile gazed at it with a clear sad expression but she shook her head and began to undo some of the buttons of her military shirt. Until it clicked Suzaku just watched with a confused look, then it hit him- Cecile was taking off her shirt! Immediately the little guy got flustered and flailed his arms until his eyes were properly covered. On the other side of the room Cecile turned to look at him and laughed, “Why are you so nervous Suzaku?” Suzaku fumbled his lips around struggling to find words when finally his fingers parted and he dared to look.

Cecile stood at the other side of the room with her hands at her hips. She was still wearing a shirt but instead of the standard Brittanian uniform it was a revealing white, spaghetti-strap top. At some point she also removed her boots too, leaving her feet bare but the brown army skirt still remained. The giantess shuffled her feet before beginning to walk towards Suzaku, each step sending out tremors. “You didn’t think I was getting naked did you?”

The steps stopped just short of Suzaku and once more he found himself struggling to form words. The current situation put him into an entirely different mindset and all he could think about was how beautiful his gigantic friend was. He noticed the dark blue bra straps that were longer than the straps to her shirt. He saw how her chest jutted out to a size that rivaled even Kallen’s. He was able to see right up her skirt to the matching dark blue panties. And on either side of him were two admittedly cute feet that lead up to towering legs that were well-built and silky smooth even to his shrunken eyes. “W-Well I mean…It did look like you were taking your shirt off.”

Cecile’s eyes narrowed playfully, “If anyone else was in this situation I’d probably step on them for being a pervert.” As if to demonstrate the giantess raised her left foot and flexed her toes in Suzaku’s face. It left him with the odd realization her toes were painted to match her hair. “…But I know you’re not like that.” She giggled and knelt back so her chest before Suzaku. To the poor Japanese soldier all he could notice was how close Cecile’s cleavage was to coming out of her shirt. “I just wanted to get a bit more comfortable to help with your training.”

“O-Oh yeah…” Suzaku felt his face beginning to cool off at last. “I still need weights if I want to do what I usually do. But if not I can figure something else out.”

“You don’t have to worry about that Suzaku. I already figured out what you can use as a weight. Something perfectly safe- like you said, heavy but soft as a pillow.”
It instantly fit into place. “Oh duh, a pillow! At my size that might be perfect!”

Cecile smiled, “Not quite. I thought that for a second too but finding a pillow might take a little while so I came up with something else.”

“What?”

The giantess averted her gaze with a slight blush, “Let’s just say you’ve been looking at them the whole time.”

The redness of the shrunken man’s face returned full storm as he stared directly at Cecile’s breasts. Nothing more needed to be said. The perverted thoughts took over anyway; all Suzaku could think about was how…big they were. In comparison to his size a nipple would be as big as him. So compared to the entire breast it was somewhere around fifty to a hundred times his size. True to what Cecile said though it would be as soft as can be. But…”I-I can’t do that Miss Cecile! That would be just-just-“

“Just fine.” The woman finished. “I can’t use any other body part because there’s a chance I might sneeze or something and it could be dangerous. This way no matter what it’d be soft enough to ensure your safety. Besides, it’s my idea so it’s not like I’m going to get mad or anything.”

“But still! It’d be too…awkward!”

Cecile shifted herself to all fours and loomed her chest above Suzaku, her face a deep red the entire time. “Just think of it…like a new type of training.” There was a small laugh and before Suzaku could comment Cecile brought her chest down to the Brittanian. Out of instinct Suzaku fell to his back and braced himself to catch the mountain he had no hope of escaping. In a split second he went from standing in embarrassment to holding up one of Cecile’s breasts in embarrassment. Surprisingly the weight in relation to his size was pretty ideal, Suzaku struggled to keep it up but it wasn’t an impossible task. Just holding his arms as they were was a good exercise in itself.

He tried to suppress any perverted thoughts that entered his mind but…he just couldn’t. Each and every little detail of Cecile’s body began to invade his senses. There was a faint smell of perfume applied hours ago. Out of the corner of his eyes Suzaku spotted a few strands of Cecile’s hair near the floor. Also in the corner of his vision was his friend’s nipple just close enough to tease him. The supple flesh of the endowed giantess seemed to give way to his hands, almost seeming to invite him into its mounds. His fingers could fit into the threads and beyond. Through his palms Suzaku could feel the echoing tremors of Cecile’s heart. Little details no one else would ever notice unless they were as close as he was invaded his mind. No matter how much he tried, Suzaku could not help but acknowledge the beauty of his friend right now. All he could do was hold up her bosom until he felt his workout was satisfactory, he couldn’t exactly bench something this soft and he was in no position to move or make demands either. He was pretty much helpless to Cecile’s whims; thankfully she was about as nice as can be but something about that thought really haunted the increasingly perverted mindset he was in.

Above a faint giggle could be heard. Cecile’s face was bright red but she found herself enjoying the ran idea she went with. Years of spending time with Lloyd gave her an odd mentality so unusual ideas were usually her first ones. Somehow playing with the shrunken Suzaku had this bizarre, empowering appeal to it; he was struggling to keep one of her breasts from hitting the ground. Someone who was usually so powerful and active was essentially helpless. She had to admit, Cecile found the idea oddly appealing. She had barely moved a muscle since entering this position but with each passing second the idea of spending more time with her shrunken friend seemed more pleasant.

Of course, after about ten minutes of this strangely intimate state, Suzaku felt his arms begin to weaken and Cecile noticed it too. Without confirmation from him Cecile raised herself and knelt back down to her previous position. “Wow…that was actually kind of nice.” She spouted off without a thought.

Suzaku began gasping for air to try and calm his young mind down. But he had to agree, “It was kind of um…awkward but you’re right.”

“Don’t pretend you didn’t like it.’’ Cecile gave an uncharacteristic playful wink. “You lasted ten whole minutes, that’s something to be proud of. You deserve a reward.”

“Reward?” Suzaku’s mind fired back into the perverted mindset.
11321.title: "Pillow" Training!

choices: They find Lloyd in no time and begin to talk about a cure
They never find Lloyd. When the day ends Cecile heads home with Suzaku
113211.content:
(Sorry, I originally wrote this as one chapter but it was just long enough to become two.")

Cecile nodded, her own cheeks flaring up. Her fingers wrapped around Suzaku before anything else could be said. Her own mind was racing after everything, almost without a thought her body acted of its own accord. Suzaku was brought near her lips and then…she gently kissed the young man who fit between two fingers. She pulled him away with a soft smile, but her expression quickly changed to a dismayed look. “Oh! I’m sorry! I wasn’t thinking, I just got carried away and-“

Strangely enough Suzaku was acting the same way, apparently he kissed back without realizing it. The two stared at eachother’s frantic actions and seemed to calm down. Everything entered into a eerie silence.

“Training can get intense.” Suzaku finally muttered after a minute of being dangled in the silence.

“Y-Yeah.” Cecile nodded with a nervous smile.

“I say we call it early today.”

“I agree.”

The next couple minutes were oddly quiet as Cecile put Suzaku down and put her jacket and boots back on. Gently she plucked Suzaku back up and placed him in her pocket. Considering the recent situation both people blushed but Cecile mumbled, "I just need to put you somewhere until we find Lloyd." Suzaku nodded, convinced, but that sentence sounded almost as if Cecile was trying to convince herself too. Once he was in place Cecile exited and began her search.
113211.title: Awkward Kiss

choices: Corneilia; apparently alive and wishing to discuss Euphie
Viletta Nu, here to give an update regarding Lelouch's activities
1133.title: Who does Suzaku See?

12.content:
Time for a girl to get smaller, then meet a bigger girl.

Who shall it be?
12.title: Little Girl

121.content:
Some men hunger for revenge, never satisfying their appetites no matter how much carnage they bring about. For a certain with, all she hungered for was a release to the pointless existence she had found herself living, that and pizza; lots of warm, gooey pizza.

“Mmmmmm, next time no anchovies,” muttered the centuries old C.C. as she took a bite out of her pizza. C.C. was someone that stood out in a crowd with her long, lime green hair, strange tattoo in the middle of her head and cold attitude, but right now as she sat in Lulouch’s room enjoying a pizza, she looked like any normal bored young girl. She was waiting for Lelouch to come back from a mission with his Black Knights. He had taken them to steal some advanced Britannian technology that was being shipped over to Area 11 to help fight off the rebellion. Knowing that they could use whatever their enemies had created, he’d gone to get it first. Honestly though, C.C. hadn’t been listening very closely. As long as she got what she wanted in the end, she didn’t care what her Lulu got up to. All that mattered was him following his end of the deal.

“I wonder if there is anything on,” C.C. yawned as she flipped on the television. A shot of a large aircraft hanger filled the screen and C.C. started paying attention. She hadn’t been listening to Lulouch talk about the mission, but she clearly remembered seeing a picture of the aircraft hanger during his debrief. Curious about what Lulu had gotten up to now, she turned up the volume and listened as a reporter spoke about the incident.

“…While the Britannian military refuses to comment, it is clear that whatever weapon they were carrying was used against them. I must warn our audience, what you will be seeing might shock you.”

C.C severely doubted anything the reporter was going to show her was going to shock her in any way. After living longer then anyone alive, there was nothing C.C. could imagine that could shock her. When the reporter lifted up her hand and showed the camera what she was carrying, C.C. thought the reporter was showing a model of a Knightmare Frame. Then C.C. noticed something tiny crawling out of the model and she nearly dropped her pizza in surprise. It wasn’t a model the reporter was holding, but a real shrunken Knightmare Frame with a real shrunken person. C.C. felt the sudden urge to laugh as she found herself wrong for the first time in a long while. She had been shocked.

“Nothing has been confirmed, but it is known that an entire fleet of Knightmare Frames are missing. It is believed that the Area 11 rebellion led by the terrorist outlaw Zero is to be blamed. If anyone has any information about Zero please contact…”

C.C. shut off the television, no longer needing to hear anything more. If Lelouch was responsible for shrinking that Knightmare Frame and it’s pilot and was also responsible for an entire fleet disappearing then things were about to get very interesting. If Lelouch and his rebellion gained control of something that could shrink objects and people, Britannia was doomed. That kind of power was unheard of, even for the power of the kings couldn’t shrink armies. Lelouch had his rebellion in the bag if he had control of whatever let him shrink things. Soon it seemed, his mission would be over and he could complete his contract to her, giving her the eternal rest she had desired for so long.

“Soon,” C.C. said as she laid back on Lelouch’s bed and closed her eyes. She was resting before Lelouch returned because she had a strange feeling that things were going to move very quickly once he returned. She’d have to remain cool, no need for him to know how excited she was. She had an image to maintain as a cold, heartless witch, couldn’t let that slip away just because she was excited. She had just gotten down her bored, emotionless expression when she heard the door opening. She turned her head to the side, not bothering to sit up or hide the empty pizza boxes littered around the room.

“You’re home early,” she wearily spoke and opened her eyes. Instead of seeing the annoyed, grumpy face of her personal knight, she saw the barrel of a silver gun pointed at her face. More surprised then frightened, she closed her eyes again and waited to get shot in the face. She really hated getting shot in the face.

There was no bang from a gun, but rather a swooshing sound like the one a camera makes. C.C. felt funny for a second, it wasn’t the pain of dying she felt, but a tingling that ran right down her body. Opening her eyes again, she sat up suddenly and three things became very obvious. One, she wasn’t hurt, two, she was naked and three, why did everything feel so much better. She stared in front of her, mouth hanging open as she saw her clothes spread out in front of her on the bed now bigger then a football field.

Standing up on unsteady feet, C.C. looked wildly around her, unable to fully comprehend what she saw. The small bedroom she had been in was no more, but a room big enough to fill a whole city surrounded her. Her eyes turned to what were once furniture, but were now enormous structures. C.C. breathed hard as she looked cat the world through the eyes of a bug, her brain unable to make sense of anything. She looked at the pizza she had once been eating and nearly fainted. A slice of pepperoni was now big enough for her to wrap herself in. You’d think seeing her favorite food jumbo sized would make the pizza gobbling girl happy, but it only made her feel sick. She had been shrunken and was now rendered helpless.

“Look at how the mighty have fallen.”

An unforgiving voice boomed above C.C.’s head and she pushed her head far back to see who it was. She trembled as she looked seemingly hundreds of feet up, looking up into the face of the person responsible for her sudden decrease in stature. It was when she recognized the colossal that she truly became afraid.
121.title: The Decline of C.C.

1211.content:
It was impossible for C.C. not to tremble in fear as she looked up at the enormous face of Zero’s right hand woman Kallen Stadtfeld. The half Britannian, half Eleven looked back at C.C. coldly, licking her lips as her eyes went over the tiny green haired girl. C.C. felt very uncomfortable under the giant girl’s gaze and tried to cover her chest and crotch, but she still felt her steely gaze focused on her. Questions raced through C.C.’s mind beyond how she had shrunken. Kallen knew her as an associate of Zero, and as far as C.C. knew Kallen had no idea that Zero and Lelouch were the same person. So why did she look not surprised at all to find her in Lelouch’s room and why was she here in the first place? So many questions raced through C.C.’s mind, but she found herself unable to speak any of them. The towering figure in front of her robbed her of her voice or ability to move. All C.C. could do was stare in awe and fear.

“What? No comeback! No scathing look? No screaming to be turned back to normal? I’m actually disappointed,” Kallen pouted and crossed her arms over her large chest. C.C. broke out of her stupor with a snap, taking a deep breath of air as she regained her composure. She was an ancient being, practically a goddess, she needed to act her part. Narrowing her eyes up at the giantess, C.C. became the dignified, coolheaded witch that she always saw herself as.

“You will return me to normal right away, I demand it!” She forcefully commanded, the power of the kings glowing in her eyes. Kallen snorted disdainfully. While C.C. could be intimidating, right now she just looked like an annoying insect with a squeaky voice. It was honestly funny hearing her try to sound like she had authority, but Kallen wasn’t laughing. This prideful bug was disrespecting her and she couldn’t have her thinking she had any power.

“That’s more like it. I thought you were going to start crying for a second,” Kallen coldly chuckled and C.C. tried to remain defiant. Kallen turned her eyes away from the shrunken victim, knowing there was nowhere the bug could go. Moving slowly to the side, she sat her well-rounded bottom down right beside the helpless witch. C.C. watched Kallen, trying not to become frightened when she saw her bottom come down beside her. The bed shook when she sat down, knocking C.C. off her feet and onto the soft bed. She quickly tried to get back to her feet, trying desperately not to look weak and failing miserably. Eventually getting to her feet, C.C. scrambled towards Kallen a furious look on her normally passive face. Hate and violence she could deal with, but the completely aloof attitude she was getting from Kallen, like she didn’t even exist, was frustrating her.

“What do you think you are doing? Do you know who I am? Return me to normal or else!” C.C. screamed as she slammed her fist into Kallen’s thigh. The giantess barely felt the blow, she did clearly hear the condescending attitude however and that got a reaction from her. Kallen had planned to let the newly shrunken witch get used to her new size before laying down the new ground rules, but the stupid bug didn’t seem to understand her position. Sighing, she reached down for her.

C.C. nearly screamed when she saw fingers as thick as telephone polls coming towards her. She ducked, which did absolutely nothing, and the giants fingers scooped her up. Hanging on tightly. C.C. was lifted upwards until she was face to face with Kallen. She could see her reflection in Kallen’s bright blue eyes and what she saw made her feel ill. She saw herself as some tiny creature hanging helplessly from someone’s fingers like a piece of rubbish that had gotten stuck. It made her feel disgusting and she looked away, instead turning her eyes to the cold, evil smile of her giant holder. Seeing gleaming teeth bigger then her was no less disturbing to C.C.

As though she wasn’t freaked out enough, Kallen reached with her free hand for C.C. and pinched one of her legs between her fingers. A cry escaped C.C. when she felt her leg being squeeze tightly between the massive digits. Kallen was being gentle, but to C.C. it felt like her leg was going to be ripped off. Having no patience or sympathy, Kallen lifted C.C. up into the air by her leg, dangling her upside down only a few inches from her face. Screams came from C.C. as she squirmed like a wounded animal in Kallen’s grip. Tiring herself out quickly, she was left panting and her arms hanging out. When Kallen spoke next, C.C. listened to her for the first time.

“You really are sad and pathetic. You act so high and mighty when your standing with Zero, but alone and helpless you whine like a bitch. You know what you remind me of, an arrogant Britannian aristocrat, and there’s only one way to deal with your kind.”

Kallen’s negative feelings towards the arrogant Britannians was not news to C.C. Lulouch talked about her distain for the condescending Britannians and C.C. had seen the open hate towards them on Kallen’s face in person. Feeling her fear growing, C.C. calmly asked, “How do you deal with arrogant Britannian aristocrats?”

Kallen smiled, a cruel, heartless smile that did not make C.C. like her chances of Kallen’s solution being anything good.
1211.title: Kallen with C.C.

choices: C.C. is on the floor by Kallen's naked feet
12111.content:
“I kill them,” Kallen said simply. Technically, she didn’t believe all stuffy, amoral Britannian aristocrats deserved, maybe just leave Area 11 alone and let the Japanese people reclaim their heritage. However, C.C. needed to die and there was no other way around it. Kallen had big plans and if the miniature witch was around her dreams might come crashing down. She stared at the insect sized girl, pondering what methods she should use to get rid of her.

C.C. was rendered speechless after getting a death sentence from the giant girl. Kallen seemed to know more then she was supposed to, but she seemed unaware that C.C. was immortal. There was nothing on this planet that could kill the centuries old girl, no firearm, blade or bomb could keep her down for good, which stunk because she wanted death. Sick of the world and the people living in it, she wanted the embrace of death, but if this girl thought she could deliver it then she had another thing coming.

Then an idea struck C.C., Kallen had shrunk her and maybe that had ridded her of her pesky immortality. Her Geass kept her alive, but maybe now that she was smaller then a baby’s thumb she no longer had her abilities. It was possible, actually, it was very likely. Instead of getting upset at that thought, C.C. felt really good. She wanted to die, the plan had been to give Lelouch her Geass after he finished the whole ‘liberating the people, discovering his mother's murder and blah, blah, blah’ thing that he had going, but if C.C. could hurry it up by getting this silly girl to kill her, all the better. Sorry Lelouch, you’re on your own now.

“Not even going to beg,” Kallen asked curiously. She had expected some kind of reaction, but the completely unbothered look that had appeared on C.C.’s face after being told she was going to de was actually slightly creepy. Kallen wasn’t a cruel, or at least not as cruel as some people, but she had wanted to hear at least a little pleading from the shrunken girl. Bringing the tiny upside down girl closer to her face, Kallen waited for a response, and she got one a moment later; C.C. gave her a pleased smile.

“I very much doubt that you can kill me. Your pathetic,” C.C. taunted. If the girl couldn’t kill her, she was just telling her the truth, but if she could kill her, the insult she had spouted would hurry up the process. C.C. didn’t like her new size, didn’t like how helpless she felt. The sooner she got her wish and died the better. Living as an insect was not something she wanted to go on doing.

Kallen looked dumbfounded for a few seconds. Hearing the powerless bug insult her and ignore her threat was something that Kallen couldn’t believe she was hearing. Slowly it sank in and she grit her teeth at the bug. “You cocky bitch,” she spat, actually sending spittle flying at C.C. A look of disgust formed on C.C.’s face as she was sprayed with saliva. Thick drops the size of her head burst against her naked body, dripping down her dangling form until she was soaked. Wiping the thick spit out of her eyes, she glared at Kallen, now pissed off. When was the stupid girl going to get it over and kill her?

“What are you waiting for, kill me! Or are you scared?” C.C. coolly taunted, hoping to get the giantess to finish what C.C. had started with Lelouch. She wanted Kallen angry enough to kill her quickly. Slow, painful deaths were always bad and if this was going to be the last time C.C. got mortally wounded, she’d prefer it to come without any fuss. It wasn’t as if killing her would be that hard for Kallen, all she needed to do was drop her onto the floor and the fall would probably do it. Staring frostily into Kallen’s eyes, C.C. dared her to make a move. “So what are you, too pathetic or scared to do the deed?”

“No,” Kallen said, gritting her teeth and grabbing C.C. as she dangled from her fingers. Turning the girl right side up, Kallen made sure that C.C. was able to see her properly and not miss anything she was going to say. “The reason your still alive is because I haven’t exactly decided how to get rid of you. I was thinking I’d flush you down the toilet and let you drown or maybe I should sit down on you and feel your tiny lips kiss my ass before crushing you or maybe I should just treat you like the bug you are and put you in a jar, screw on the top and let you suffocate. How do you want to go, drowning, crushing or suffocation?”

Those fates should have horrified C.C. but after suffering through the various means of execution that the Spanish Inquisition had to offer, there was no death that could frighten her. Still, the thought of being so helpless and pathetic in her last moments of life did send a chill up her spine. It seemed that her death was going to be as messy as possible. Still, she wanted everything to end.

“Speechless,” Kallen snidely commented, taking C.C.’s deliberation as fear. Sighing, C.C. closed her eyes, hoping that if she did nothing Kallen would get bored and kill her. Kallen waited for a response, shaking her fist slightly to see if she could get the bug to talk. After getting the silent treatment for several minutes, Kallen huffed in annoyance. The game was over and it was time to end things, she had much better things to do then play with the soon to be forgotten green haired girl.

Air rushed past C.C. as moved her hand down. Keeping her eyes closed, the shrunken immortal didn’t open them until she felt the fingers around her loosen and roll her onto a hard surface. When she opened her eyes and saw where she was, a feeling of relief hit C.C. like a ton of brinks. She covered her mouth to keep Kallen from seeing her smile. She was finally going to die, not in a pleasant way, but that didn’t matter. She was happy to be executed, no matter what the method was.
12111.title: Happy to Die

121111.content:
C.C. lied on her side; staring blankly at a giant, bare foot a few yards from her. Kallen’s foot almost looked like a wall of flesh to the tiny girl. C.C.’s eyes wandered up and down it, looking at her stumpy pinkie toe, which was like a giant boulder to her to her curved heel. It was a fifty times her size and could crush her instantly, which was just what C.C. wanted.

“So I decided that I wanted your lips as far away from my butt as possible.”

Rolling to her back, C.C. jadedly looked up at the giant face of Kallen looming high above her. There was a small smile on her face, not the sadistic smirk she had before, but a much more peaceful and understanding smile. It was like Kallen felt nothing about what she was about to do, no satisfaction or guilt. Somehow, C.C. found that almost insulting. The girl had been positively giddy about destroying her and now she looked like she didn’t care. What was the deal?

“So you’re going to step on me,” C.C. didn’t ask, but clarified.

“Pretty much. I really just want to get this over with and get back to something important,” Kallen explained and this time C.C. absolutely felt disrespected. What was so important the Kallen wanted to get to? Did she have some other people she wanted to shrink or was C.C. just a small distraction for her. The idea of Kallen shrinking more people played through C.C.’s mind. With a weapon that could rob people of their size, Kallen might have become the most powerful person in the world. Anyone or anything she wanted could be made small and powerless, it was a power that was nearly godlike. Whatever Kallen had planned must be big, but in the end it mattered little to C.C. because this was the end for her.

“I thought the best place for you would be under my feet,” Kallen sniffed, lightly moving her feet and nudging the tiny naked girl. “You know, I really thought this would be more fun. I’ve hated you since the first time I saw you with Zero. You acted so high and mighty, and the way you looked at Zero, it was like you thought you owned him. It disgusted me.”

C.C.’s eyes widened as she pieced together the reason for the hostility she was getting from Kallen. She thought the little brat was just on a power trip because she shrunk her, but that wasn’t it at all. This was because of the most common reason that little girls fight, a silly, childish reason that C.C. always found ridiculous. C.C. had almost respected Kallen as a strong woman, but now she only saw her as a schoolgirl with a crush. She started laughing unable to control herself.

“You have a crush on Zero,” she said between laughter. “The reason you shrunk me was because you were jealous. You really are pathetic!”

Kallen became flush as the tiny laughter from the bug’s mouth reached her and then she got angry. Scowling, Kallen lifted up her foot. “The feelings I have towards Zero aren’t the only reason I have to kill you, but they are the reason doing this feels so good.”

C.C. stopped laughed as she lied under the giant shadow of Kallen’s foot. The first thing she noticed was how many wrinkles their were on the bottom of her foot, she never really thought about it. The second was how bad Kallen’s feet stank. C.C. had never known a person to have feet that smelled like roses, but the thick aroma coming off of Kallen’s feet made her retch. Breathing through her mouth, C.C. waited for Kallen to stomp her foot down, but instead the giantess slowly lowered her giant foot.

“While you were sitting here, eating pizza, I have been running around all day, helping Zero liberate my home, so I hope you don’t mind if my feet are a little sweaty.”

C.C. did mind, but she bared through the smell, trying to think of something worse she had smelt during her long years. It was hard to think of anything fouler as Kallen’s foot came closer down on her and the smell got worse. Maybe shrinking made her sense of smell better? C.C. wasn’t sure, but she kept waiting, watching the sole of Kallen’s foot lowering slowly towards her like a pendulum blade. Her sole glistened with sweat and a big drop landed on C.C.’s body. Now covered in sweat and saliva, C.C. felt like she was ready to die now.

“Finally,” C.C. grumbled as Kallen’s sole hung inches from her face. She closed her eyes and waited for death, but like life it didn’t come as she expected. Kallen’s sole pushed against her body, covering C.C. in her thick, terrible foot sweat. The smell became suffocating as it became all she could smell. Kallen started applying pressure, but much to C.C.’s horror, she went slow, allowing C.C. to sink slightly into the soft flesh of her sole and hold her there. There was a huge pressure all over C.C.’s body, keeping her from breathing or moving. She thought death wouldn’t come from being crushed, but rather suffocating, but then Kallen relaxed and pushed her foot down. It was barely a twitch, but it crushed every bone in C.C.’s body instantly.

Death came suddenly and mercifully to the centuries old witch. No more of the smell of feet, no more pain, just blissful darkness. Her last thought was hope that Lelouch got what he wanted and Kallen, the girl that had given her what she wanted and humiliated her in the process, was shot in the head, twice.
121111.title: Slow Way to Die

1211111.content:
To experience death is in itself an unknown feeling. Not one person in known existence can truthfully say they know what it feels like, whether it is painless or pain-filled, long or short, or even if anything happens at all. C.C. was no exception to this rule; she had come so close to death an immeasurable amount of times but just as it came she always revived; such was the nature of her curse, the curse of immortality. What she experienced with each death was actually what many commonly see. The long tunnel with a light at the end, and the light coming in fast. Most people are too terrified or worried to really notice much about it but through continous encounters C.C. had memorized all about it. It started out in the shape of a doorway but as it came closer it also grew, soon becoming nothing but a blinding white light that covered all the darkness. Contrary to belief of some it gave C.C. a sense of warmth and comfort; in fact it was her theory that this meant the feeling was her about to go to heaven...and then her curse kicked in. That wonderful near euphoric feeling would vanish in a heartbeat as pain filled its void. C.C. would awaken to her mortal wounds in complete agony, but unable to die. As her body rapidly heals in seconds she calmly arises and acts as if nothing happened at all, and with the constant deaths even when the wounds are there she rarely actually shrieked in pain. This entire process was not the case here.

When Kallen's massive sole began to lower C.C., for the first time in her cursed life, saw her life flash before her eyes; the life equivalent to ten lives. It had been so long....C.C. couldn't even remember the years she were born in. It was before the colonies....around the medieval era....but she couldn't place a date. Most of the faces she always remembered as blurrs were now crystal clear. Her friends, her proposers, the witch who cursed her in order to escape it herself...it all played out. C.C. was never one for nostalgia (Or many other emotions for that matter) but seeing all this again....it brought the feeling back in full force. She was the witch who endured time, yet no one had touched her quite like Lelouch did. Ah...Lelouch...just thinking of his name brought visions of him. She never would've admitted it to most but Lelouch....he revived the old witch's heart and brought humanity back into her soul. She probably even loved him but with her old being she couldn't tell. But it didn't matter anyway, the two were far too different. C.C. was a witch who craved death and he was a power hungry boy bent on revenge...C.C. gave him the means to fight, nothing more. Now the battle was all his.

The foot made contact with C.C....and she felt her happiness swell up amidst the pain. This pain was greater than any before, whether it was just more powerful than anything priorly experienced was insignificant; C.C. was sure now, this would be her death, beneath Kallen's foot like a cockroach. It was sort of ironic, C.C. spent the better part of a millenia acting better than everyone, no different than a school bully beating up a wimp to make themselves stop from crying at night; and now she was going to die like a bug. Had to love the irony there. C.C. didn't care if Kallen spat on her or anything, this was the death she had long awaited; hell if she could move she might actually hug the sweaty flesh surrounding, The intensified taste, scent...not a single wisp of it bothered her, any second C.C.'s wish would come true.

Miles above Kallen burst into power crazed laughter, "How do you feel C.C.? Dying like a bug beneath my foot? I hope you like that sweat, I worked it up especially for you! Lick or something and I may let you live."

C.C. had no intention of doing so, for two reasons. One was pride, dying, happy, sad, whatever C.C. did not let go of her pride. The second was her wish; Kallen offered an escape route, no doubt to make C.C. into a sort of toy for her or humiliate her, little did she know the girl at her feet actually wanted to die. She welcomed the angered Kallen's increase of pressure to kill her....which she did do.

"Why you little...I'm not one for bluffing so get ready!" Kallen lifted her foot off of C.C., raising it high into the air. C.C. smirked as she saw her blood decorate the foot in a mixture of sweat that made it seem like a weapon of mass destruction. Kallen's face was one of pure disdain, she found no quarrel with what she intended to do and probably enjoyed it in fact. Both girls exchanged a last glance with one another. To Kallen all she saw was the green haired girl as a bug, it gave a primal thrill to see the high and mighty C.C. almost a pool of blood beneath her foot....it was nice. To C.C. Kallen looked like...well a benevolent goddess. Her body rose so high that, combined with the blood loss, C.C. could not make out the details past Kallen's waist; it was naught but a blur. All she could make out was her grin, or at least the basis of it.

Kallen laughed one last time, "Hey C.C. before I finish you off I have a lil gift" With the loud sound of phlegm Kallen spat on C.C.'s small battered body. If she's down, might as well make it worse, she figured. But...enough stalling....time for the big finish. Kallen kept it simple; applying all her strength to her leg Kallen gave the greatest stomp of her life, a stomp which no doubt eradicated C.C.'s very existance instantaneously. To C.C. it seemed to last an eternity, but when it finally did in fact come she could never have been happier. It was the death she would have preferred, painless; although the medium was one she didn't like it did the job. Kallen wiped C.C. out of existance in a mere instant, unknowingly making C.C. the happiest woman alive.

As always C.C. came to the tunnel, and as always the light came. However this time once its soft embrace grasped ahold of the girl, it did not let go. She was finally at peace and fulfilled her wish. Yet...her mind was not on how she died, how her wish was fulfilled or even what was to come; it was on Lelouch. More memories surfaced of the boy, and C.C. finally realized it.

"Lelouch....I love you....and I pray you defeat Brittania." Those words were the last ties that binded the witch to this world and with them finally cut C.C. floated into the light, more than happy to finally be at peace with her cursed life...
1211111.title: The Wish Fulfilled

choices: C.C. manages to pull herself from Kallen's socks
1211112.content:
It’s hard to describe what it feels like to return to life. The closest thing to it is waking up completely all of a sudden from a deep sleep. One second you feel nothing and then your wide awake. C.C. had gone through this hundreds of times and it never got easier. One second she was dead and the next she was breathing again. Her eyes shot open and she at up, holding her hand to her breast as images of what had happened flashed through her head. It takes a few seconds for brain activity to return to normal, and once the brain is fully functioning, C.C. has all of her full physical abilities.

“Fuck,” C.C. said, using her ability to speak to utter a rare swear. She was alive, how unlucky could she be.

“I’m never going to die,” she soberly said, pulling her knee up and hugging them as she feel into a deep depression. She had really thought her wishes were going to be answered and she’ get the death she sought, but she had been disappointed again. She was still immortal, even though she had shrunken, it was almost enough to almost make the cyclical girl cry. But no tears came as she steadied herself. She’d find some way to end her misery one way or another. Being shrunken didn’t do it, but something would.

She was still shrunken; that fact had been momentarily put aside as she focused on her other source of misery. She was a helpless, tiny girl still in the clutches of a lovesick, terrorist who had a few moments prior delivered a humiliating, painful death to her. Fear raced through her as she wondered what the twisted girl was thinking right now. Looking around wildly, C.C. tried to find the giant tormentor, but couldn’t find her. After crushing her, Kallen must have left, not giving the tiny crushed corpse a second thought. She probably thought the maid would clean up the mess thinking she was just some squashed insect. Thank goodness that the psycho brat didn’t decide to dispose of her body. The last thing C.C. needed was to have woken from death to find herself floating in the toilet about to be flushed like a child’s dead goldfish. She was safe, for now.

“I told you I was taking care of something important. I’ll be back in less then an hour, you can hold down things until then. Yes, I am aware that he’s asking for me and tell him I’ll be back soon. I left you in charge because I thought you could handle a simple thing like looking after our leader. Don’t give me that tone!”

Kallen’s booming voice made C.C. running further away from the bed to get a better look at her surroundings. Her heartbeat sped up as she saw Kallen stomping around on the other side of the bed while talking on a phone. Her giant form moved quickly around as she tried to have a conversation, her steps shaking the wood floor under C.C.’s feet. The giantess was still in the room, leaving C.C. in a lot of danger. She wanted to die, but if Kallen found her, what she’d get instead was pain and suffering. The memory of being crushed under her smelly feet was fresh in her mind and C.C. never wanted to experience anything like that again. Now truly afraid, she looked for somewhere to hide.

“Can you stop complaining. I told you already, I have that shrinking gun we stole from the Britannian’s and its safe. Unless the problem is you don’t trust me?” Kallen accused, toying with the silver gun that she had used to shrink C.C. The shrunken girl watched the giantess, her eyes never traveling downwards to the floor. She ran fast towards the bed, hoping to find sanctuary under the colossal bed. If she could keep the cruel giantess from finding her, maybe she could get someone to help her. Like, maybe Lelouch’s maid Sayoko. Being found by her had to be a hundred times better then being captured by Kallen. Making a dash for the bed, C.C managed to get out of sight just as Kallen would have clearly seen her. The young girl was still on the phone, having an argument with unseen people.

“How many times do I have to say it, keep the hostages safe and secure. I don’t care how small they are, if one of them goes missing or I find them stuck to the bottom of anyone’s shoe, you’ll answer to me. Got it, good! I’ll be back soon.” Kallen closed her cell and sighed, wondering how Lelouch made giving orders to the Black Knights look so easy. She sat down on the bed, making the bedsprings squeal and a very scared, naked wet girl cringe.

Kallen’s naked feet hung just in front of C.C. Deadly weapons that could kill or smoother her easily. The retched smell was back and C.C. covered her nose to try and avoid it. She started backing away, trying to get as far from Kallen as possible, but was stopped as she felt something soft and warm push up against her back. Turning around, she stared at the building sized white cotton blob that was before her. The smell of feet hadn’t been coming from Kallen’s dangling footies, but rather this misshapen giant cloth. “Now where did I leave my socks?”

With growing dread, C.C. realized that she had stumbled onto Kallen’s discarded socks, which at this moment she was looking for. Wondering which god she had angered to be so cursed, C.C. tried to get away, but it was too late, Kallen was reaching for her socks. Bending over, Kallen reached under the bed, her giant fingers moving past the tiny girl and grabbing onto the socks. For a moment, C.C. thought she was safe, then Kallen started dragging them out and C.C. was pulled out with them. It was like a wave of cotton pulled her along. She fell face first into the cottony fabric; her already soaked body rubbing into more foot sweat. C.C. tried to entangle herself, but it looked like she was too late. Kallen had caught her without even knowing that she was still alive.
1211112.title: Alive and Scared

choices: Kallen experiments with other methods to kill C.C.
12111121.content:
When Kallen reached for her socks, all she could think about was what she was going to do when she got back to the rebellions headquarters, but any thought about that was thrown out the window when she saw something tumbling out from under the bed followed by her socks. Kallen stared blankly at the dirty, naked girl on the floor in front of her. At first, her brain denied what she was seeing was real. She had killed C.C. a few minutes ago. She had looked at her crushed corpse and even gloated, saying that it was a fitting end for such a pest. But there she was, looking like a mess with her hair in shambles and dirt and sweat covering her body, but she was alive. The confusion from seeing her alive slowly dwindled and was replaced by a cold growing anger.

“Damn it all,” C.C. cursed under her breath as she kept her head down in fear of what she’d see above her. She had tried to pull herself off the socks, and she might have succeeded, if they hadn’t been wet from all of Kallen’s sticky sweat. Now she was free of them and out in the open for Kallen to see. She didn’t even bother standing back up, preferring to remain on her back as the evil girl did her worse. C.C. tried to reason with her, quickly because she knew time was essential.

“Please, listen to me. Whatever you think is wrong, I’m not interested in Zero, I’m not interested in anything you do. Turn me back to normal and I swear you will never see me again, I promise,” C.C. pleaded. She waited for a response, a snide remark, anything. Kallen remained silent. Hazarding a look, C.C. lifted her head and paled at a familiar sight hovering above her head. Kallen’s foot was once more poised to crush her and above her massive naked foot, Kallen looked down with rage.

“Die!” She hissed and brought her foot down. This was no slow, descending doom but rather a stomp. One second C.C was staring at the sweaty, filthy sole of the giantess and then darkness. The sensation of the hot, smooth bottom of her slippery sole crushing her was the last sensation C.C. felt; for a few minutes.

Once more, C.C. felt the uncomfortable sensation of coming back to life. Her eyes sprang open and she sat up, right to the sight of an enraged Kallen looming above her. The giantess had stuck around to make sure she was really dead and seeing that she had failed again, Kallen reached a whole new level of anger. Snarling she brought down her foot again on the puny girl, only not with the same strength or velocity as she had previously. C.C. raised her hands up feebly to stop the giant sole from crushing her again, which only succeeded in breaking both her arms instead of her neck. She was pinned again under her sole, being smothered in the sticky, flesh and unable to move. C.C. was surprised to feel herself still alive, although she was still in a great amount of pain.

The crushing weight of Kallen’s sole weighed down on her, pulverizing bones and suffocating her. The pain was so much that C.C. had to scream, opening her mouth and getting a mouthful of Kallen’s grimy sole. She could taste sweat, grime and dirt, it was the most rancid thing she had ever tasted. She coughed up blood as her stomach clenched, her body reacting badly to the horrible taste combined with the pain. Right now, C.C. wanted to die more then ever, not because she thought she would die for the last time, but just to escape the pain and revulsion.
She didn’t get death, but Kallen did lift her foot up. The look of disgust on Kallen’s face when she saw what she’d done spoke volumes about how messed up C.C.’s body was. C.C. thought the giantess would leave her alone, instead she grumbled, “Why won’t you die,” and brought her foot down again.

Hot, smelly crushing weight was on C.C. again, lighter then ever before. Kallen was no longer trying to crush her, but just pulverize her body. Whether she was doing it to hurt C.C. bad enough so she would stay dead or just for fun, C.C. didn’t know, but she guessed that it was both. C.’C could feel herself start to slip away as the pressure continued. She stared into the pink, wrinkles on the bottom of Kallen’s sole, wondering if she’d wake up seeing them. She was nearly dead again when Kallen started twisting her sole into the puny creature. Arching her toes, she ground her sole into C.C. over and over again, not stopping until there was nothing left but a smear. Even then she stomped it again, just to make sure. With nothing left but a bloody stain, Kallen walked to the bathroom to clean up the bottom of her foot. She had bug juices all over her footsie.

It took C.C. twice as long to pull herself together. Bones were regrown, muscles formed and a whole body sprung up where only a smear had been. C.C. knew that all injuries were healed when she came back to life, but she felt sore when she opened her eye. It was a phantom pain from a brutal and vicious death she’d received. She could still clearly remember her bones cracking and her body flattening under the foul sole of the angry schoolgirl. Holding her sides, C.C. trembled, wondering what was next in store for her. It was hard to act cool and collect when you clearly remember parts of you liquefying.

“What am I going to do with you?” C.C. shakily looked up to Kallen who was debating what she had been thinking on the bed. The schoolgirl swung her feet from the bed directly over C.C. There was no sign she was going to step on her again, but seeing those instruments of death again made her shudder. C.C. would never let herself be broken, but she had learned to fear Kallen’s feet n a quick amount of time. Although soon, C.C. would learn to fear more of Kallen’s body parts.
12111121.title: Dead Again and Again

choices: Kallen goes to meet the Rebellion
121111211.content:
Kallen was trying to decide if C.C.’s shrunken immortality was a good thing or a bad thing. She really wanted to get rid of the annoying green haired pest, but she couldn’t argue that punishing the minuscule girl wasn’t enjoyable. Feeling bones crack under her feet and that satisfying wetness that cam when C.C. bleed was intoxicating. There were so many more humiliating things she could have C.C. do for her. After all the running around she’d done today, she could use a good foot massage or even better se could just soap C.C. up and use her to scrub her feet. C.C. would make a fine foot toy.

Mustering up her courage, C.C. got to her feet and tried to look as defiantly as she could up at the giantess. She was humiliated and traumatized, but her pride refused to let her back down for long. She spoke with all the courage she had, trying to use the one advantage she had. “You had better change me back or Zero will punish you.” The threat was weak, but it was all C.C. had. Kallen respected Zero’s authority and would listen. The little fan girl would never want to disappoint her idol.

“Big words from someone who was choking on feet a few minutes ago,” Kallen teased and chuckled as C.C. continued to try and act like she had any say in anything. She was like a little kid trying to tell their parent to go to bed; it was completely impractical. Still, Kallen had to rub some salt in the wounds. “There are two things you need to know. One, the shrink ray we took from the Britannians only shrinks, it doesn’t grow. Even if I wanted to help you, which is as likely as me kissing the Britannian Emperor, I couldn’t. You’re stuck this size, forever.”

C.C. suddenly felt very lightheaded and it had nothing to do with the feet right above her head. She was going to be this size, for as long as she lived, which was technically forever. Her legs gave out under her and she collapsed to her knees, feverously wishing she’d wake up from this dream she was trapped in. This was the worst thing to happen to her since she gained her immortality. Actually, this was probably worse. At least she had her freedom when she became immortal, now she was the slave to this giant schoolgirl. C.C. hadn’t cried in nearly five decades, but right now she felt the tears welling up in her eyes. Her immortal life had just gone from insufferable to hellish.

“Don’t cry, you haven’t heard the second part,” Kallen said in her most mocking tone of voice. Wanting to twist the knife further, Kallen smugly told C.C., “I don’t think your going to be rescued by Zero or should I say Lelouch. You’re on your own bug.”

C.C.’s head dropped in despair. So Kallen did know Zero’s secret identity like she thought, yet why was she so certain that Lelouch wouldn’t help her? Sure, they weren’t friends, but Lelouch had his twisted sense of honor, he’d never let someone that saved his life spend eternity as a foot slave. He owed her big time for giving him his Geass, it was time to call the favor in and save her, but Kallen looked pretty confident that Lelouch was no longer in the picture. That got C.C. thinking, whom else might she have shrunken with the stolen shrink ray?

“What did you do to Lelouch?” C.C. crossly asked. She didn’t really care about the boy, but he was useful to her. This girl had no right to mess with her chosen knight, especially if she claimed to have a crush on him.

“None of your business, insect. You should be more concerned about yourself. I’ve spent too long testing your ability to return to life, I have better things to do. I’m leaving.”

“Sorry to see you go, bitch,” C.C. muttered under her breath so Kallen wouldn’t hear. However, she did hear, but didn’t get angry. She just smirked at the naked, shrunken girl, enjoying every second of the game she was playing with her. Kallen never thought of herself as a sadist, but she always hated this brat and seeing her so small was bringing things out in her that she didn’t even imagine having. She wanted to hurt the bug, break her and prove to herself that she was better then she ever was. Images of how Zero always took her into his confidence raced through her head, renewing her desire to punish and torment C.C.

“I’m leaving, but your coming with me.”

“What?” C.C. stuttered, her hope washing away with Kallen’s words. She had thought she was done with her, that her fears of being her slave had been forgotten, but she was wrong. Kallen wasn’t going to simply forget about her, she was far too amusing. Kallen didn’t say anything, she just got her socks on silently and then reached for her shoes. Putting one she on, she paused and looked at C.C., who understood right away. “No.”

Taking off running, C.C. tried to escape, but at her size a snail moved at the speed of a car. She couldn’t escape Kallen, who casually reached down and pinched the tiny girl between her fingers. Trapped between her coarse fingers, C.C. was lifted off the floor and brought over to a Kallen’s shoe. She stared down into the dark, foul smelling inside of Kallen’s shoe before being dropped in. In the year 2018, the Brittanian Empire, in its quest for world domination, invaded the island nation of Japan. The Japanese army was no match for the Brittanian Knightmares and their superior technology. Within weeks, Brittania had taken over Japan, renaming it simply as Area 11. For a while, there was no trouble between the Brittanian government and the Japanese, now referred to as Elevens. But now, a resistance group known as the Black Knights, led by its mysterious leader Zero, has risen up to fight against Brittania and regain independence for Japan.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------

Outside the Tokyo settlement, a battle between the Black Knights and the Brittanians ensues. The Black Knights have cornered a key Brittanian figurehead and are attempting to kill him in order to bring down the empire. The battle is swaying in favor of the Black Knights, until...

"Enemy combatant approaching!" a Black Knight soldier reported over their radio frequency. "It doesn't look like the rest of the units."

"It's the Lancelot," Lelouch said. "Kallen, use the Guren Mk II to take it out once and for all!"

"Right!" Kallen responded.

Kallen began to head towards the Lancelot, ready to permanently take it out of commission. "You're going down this time, Brittanian scum!"

"Damn, it's that red Knightmare again," Suzaku said to himself as he encountered the Guren Mk II. "Luckily for me, this time I've got the upper hand!"

Kallen grabbed the Lancelot's right arm and began to use the Guren's Fukusha Hadou Kikou radiation wave special ability on it.

"Now burn for me, you Brittanian!" Kallen shouted.

"I don't think so!" Suzaku said calmly. The warrant officer pressed a newly added orange button on the Lancelot's control panel, recently installed by Lloyd Asplund and the other members of the Camelot staff, and waited to see what it did. Suddenly, the Lancelot's arm began to glow bright purple.

"What's going on?" Kallen wondered.

The Lancelot suddenly reversed the Guren's radiation wave and turned it on Kallen's Knightmare.

"No, this can't be! How did you...? Damn you, filthy Brittanian!" Kallen shouted as she was ejected from her frame. She could only watch as the Guren Mk II was destroyed before her very eyes.

Watching the dueling Knightmares from a safe distance, Lelouch saw this defeat happen and decided it was time to cut their losses.

"We've lost the Guren Mk II! All forces retreat!" he demanded. "We have no chance of winning now."

The Black Knights quickly left the battlefield and headed back to their base. As Kallen was flying back to Black Knight headquarters, she became filled with anger.

"How did I let that happen?" she asked herself aloud. "The Lancelot...I swear, I'll have my revenge on it, no matter what happens! And after I finish the Lancelot off, I'll destroy the entire Brittanian empire!" "

I can't believe that happened! she thought. How did I manage to lose the Guren Mk II? It was that stupid Lancelot frame that did this. I'll get my revenge on that mech and its pilot... somehow.

"Well, Kallen, I was actually sent down here for another reason. Zero wants to see you immediately."

"Zero...wants to see...me?" Kallen asked in disbelief.

"Yes, he does," CC replied. "You are to meet him in the hanger in 5 minutes. Don't be late."

"I won't!" Kallen affirmed as CC exited the room.

Kallen wondered why Zero would want to meet with her now of all times. She came to the conclusion that he would probably talk to her about a new Knightmare for her to pilot, one much better than the Guren. Kallen got up from her bed, left her room, and headed towards the hanger.

-----------------------------------------------------

"Ah, Kallen, you've arrived at last," said Zero. He was waiting with Rakshata, next to what seemed to be a ray gun of some type.

"I'm here, Zero!" Kallen shouted. "What do you want to talk to me about?"

"Well, Rakshata has come up with a new device that allows ordinary people to become the size of Knightmares. Since you have recently lost your Knightmare in combat, I thought you would be the perfect candidate to try it out."

"How does it work?" Kallen asked.

"Well," Rakshata began, "this ray alters the genetic makeup of the human body so that it can enlarge to the size of a standard Knightmare frame. All physical attributes remain the same and according to our tests, there are no known side effects of the beam...at least that we know of. Basically, you'll become a Knightmare but you'll have much greater control since you're using your own body to fight."

"Will I be stuck at that size forever?" Kallen asked.

"No. The standard size of a Knightmare is 30 ft tall. When you're first subjected to the ray, you may be that size for about 10 minutes at the most before you'll be able to return to normal. You will gain the ability to regulate your size anywhere between your natural height and your maximum height possible. Why do I say maximum height possible, you ask? The answer is simple: subsequent exposure to the beam will increase the maximum range of size of the subject. So, theoretically, if you were exposed to the ray again, your maximum height may be 45 ft instead of only 30 ft. And if you were hit yet again, your maximum height may reach 70 ft or so. But...since we don't want you becoming too big, you will only be exposed to the ray's effects once."

"Why can't I be just a bit bigger? Wouldn't I be much more helpful then?"

"Well, Kallen, to be honest, we've never actually tested the ray's compounded effect on an actual person before," Rakshata answered. "We don't know what would actually happen if there was continued exposure, or if there are any side effects for humans."

"I see," Kallen said.

"Well, Kallen, are you up for it?" Zero asked.

"Yes!" Kallen exclaimed. "Of course I am! But wait a second, won't I outgrow my clothes when I grow?"

"Yes, but Rakshata has created a special suit for you to wear for when you're in your enlarged state," answered Zero.

"I left it over there in the changing room for you, Kallen," said Rakshata.

Kallen headed over to the changing room to check out her new outfit.

"No way! You've got to be kidding me! I'm not wearing this!"
